Function to perform cFDR for continuous auxiliary covariates

flexible_cfdr.Rd

Performs Flexible cFDR for continuous auxiliary covariates

flexible_cfdr(
  p,
  q,
  indep_index,
  nxbin = 1000,
  res_p = 300,
  res_q = 500,
  gridp = 50,
  splinecorr = TRUE,
  dist_thr = 0.5,
  plot_KDE = FALSE,
  maf = NULL,
  check_indep_cor = TRUE,
  enforce_p_q_cor = TRUE
)

Arguments

p

p values for principal trait (vector of length n)
q

continuous auxillary data values (vector of length n)
indep_index

indices of independent SNPs
nxbin

number of bins in zp direction for hex-binning
res_p

number of test points in x-direction (p)
res_q

number of test points in y-direction (q)
gridp

number of data points required in a KDE grid point for left-censoring
splinecorr

logical value for whether spline correction should be implemented
dist_thr

distance threshold for spline correction
plot_KDE

logical value for whether to plot the fitted KDE
maf

minor allele frequencies for SNPs to which p and q relate
check_indep_cor

check that sign of the correlation between p and q is the same in the independent subset as in the whole
enforce_p_q_cor

if p and q are negatively correlated, flip the sign on q values

Value

list of length two: (1) dataframe of p-values, q-values and v-values (2) dataframe of auxiliary data (q_low used for left censoring, how many data-points were left censored and/or spline corrected)

Details

If maf is specified, then the independent SNPs will be downsampled to match the minor allele frequency distribution.

Contents

Developed by Anna Hutchinson, Chris Wallace, Thomas Willis.
